document.docTitle: Trogloneta uncata Lin & Li, 2013, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Five new minute orb-weaving spiders of the family Mysmenidae from China (Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new minute orb-weaving spiders of the family Mysmenidae from China (Araneae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 23. Trogloneta uncata n. sp., male holotype. A. Habitus, dorsal view; B. Ditto, ventral view; C. Ditto, lateral view; D. Prosoma, anterior view; E. Left femur I; F. Left tibia I; G. Left metatarsus I and tarsus I. E – G prolateral view. Abbrs.: CS = clasping spine, FS = femoral spot. Small arrows to trichobothria in F and G.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 24. Trogloneta uncata n. sp., male holotype. A – D. Left pedipalp. A prolateral view; B retrolateral view; C apical view; D ventral view. Abbrs.: AA = apical apophysis, AL = apical lobe, CB = cymbium, CP = cymbial process, MA = mesial apophysis, SD = spermatic duct, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum, TI = tibia.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 25. Trogloneta uncata n. sp., male holotype. A – D. Left pedipalp. A prolateral view; B retrolateral view; C apical view; D ventral view. Abbrs.: AA = apical apophysis, AL = apical lobe, CB = cymbium, CP = cymbial process, MA = mesial apophysis, SD = spermatic duct, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum, TI = tibia.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURE 26. The locality records of five new mysemids from China. 1. Mosu dayan n. sp.; 2. Mosu tanjia n. sp.; 3. Mysmena baoxingensis n. sp.; 4. Mysmenella yinae n. sp.; 5. Trogloneta uncata n. sp..

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material: Holotype
: male ( IZCAS ), Banpoyan Cave (
24 ° 56.012 ´N
,
100 ° 18.866 ´E
; Altitude 1990 m ), Huilong Mt., Xiaowan Town, Nanjian County, Yunnan, China ,
25 June 2010
, C.X. Wang, Q.Y. Zhao and L.H. Lin.
Etymology. The specific epithet is derived from the Latin adjective “uncatus” (= uncinate), in reference to the shape of the male embolus.

Diagnosis. The new species sharing the following features with other
Trogloneta
species: AME smaller than ALE (
Figs 23
A, D); eyes at apex (
Fig. 23
C); male leg I with a subdistal ventrally femoral spot and a clasping spine on metatarsus I (
Figs 23
E, G); male carapace highly elevated and conical (
Fig. 23
C); male pedipale large (at least as big as half carapace) (
Figs 23
A–B). The new species differs from Brazilian
Trogloneta
spp. (
Brescovit & Lopardo 2008
) by the opisthosoma without one posterior tubercle and the relatively simple male pedipalp; from American
T. paradoxa
(see
Gertsch 1960
: 12 , figs 12, 16) and Chinese
T. denticocleari
and
T. speciosum
(see
Lin & Li 2008
) by the presence of cymbial process (
Figs 24
A, D; 25 A, D) and the strongly hooked embolus (
Figs 24
C, 25 C); from European
T. canariensis
, the type species
T. granulum
and Madeira Is.
T. madeirensis
(see
Wunderlich 1987
) by the presence of median and apical cymbial apophysis (
Figs 24
B–D; 25 B–D) and the rugose, membranous apical lobe in pedipalpal bulb (
Figs 24
B–C, 25 B–C).

Description. Male: Holotype (
Figs 23
A–C), total length 0.79 . Prosoma 0.36 long, 0.39 wide, 0.27 high. Carapace of prosoma pale yellow, subround dorsally. Thoracic pars wrinkled marginally. Cephalic pars abruptly raised. Ocular area located at apex of carapace, covered with few setae. Eight eyes in two rows. AMEs contiguous, black. ALE, PLE and PME in triad, and white. AER and PER distinctly recurved. All eyes round, with black rings. Clypeus 0.25 high, about to 7.5 x AME diameter; ALE separated by about 4.2 x its diameter from anterolateral edge of carapace. Chelicerae pale yellow, shorter than endites (
Fig. 23
D). Labium yellow, fused to sternum. Endites yellow, rhombic, longer than wide, with serrula. Sternum 0.24 long, 0.25 wide, pale yellow, heart-shaped, plump, covered with sparse setae, without any stripes. Legs formula: I-II-IV-III. Leg measurements: I 1.36 ( 0.43 , 0.16 , 0.30 , 0.27 , 0.20 ); II 1.18 ( 0.38 , 0.14 , 0.25 , 0.23 , 0.18 ); III 0.99 ( 0.30 , 0.13 , 0.20 , 0.20 , 0.16 ); IV 1.21 ( 0.39 , 0.14 , 0.27 , 0.21 , 0.20 ). Femora and patellae light grey; tibiae, metatarsi and tarsi yellow. Femur I with a ventral sclerotized spot subdistally, and femoral cuticle wrinkle, modified by tiny stripes. Metatarsus I with a submesial clasping spine prolaterally (
Fig. 23
G). All patellae with a dorsal seta distally. Each tibia with a dorsal seta proximally and 3 trichobothria (
Fig. 23
F). Each metatarsus with a dorsal trichobothrium proximally (
Fig. 23
G). Opisthosoma 0.55 long, 0.55 wide, 0.71 high. Subround dorsally, pale yellow, with irregularly grey spots. Ventral abdomen pale. Spinnerets yellow, the anterior largest, and the posterior smallest.

Pedipalp large (
Figs 24
A–D, 25 A–D). Femur, patella and tibia without apophysis. Tibia semi-cupulate, with a few long setae along the distal margin (
Figs 24
D, 25 D). Cymbium membranous, covered with many long setae, with a dentate cymbial process prolaterally (
Figs 24
A, 25 A). Bulb large, irregular shape. subtegulum rugose, weakly slcerotized. Tegulum wide, rugose, spermatic duct visible through translucent tegulum. Median and apical apophyses triangular, distinctly sclerotized. Apical lobe translucent, wrinkled, and adjacent to apical apophysis (
Figs 24
B, 25 B). Conductor absent. Embolus large, hooked, strongly sclerotized distally, broad basally (
Figs 24
A, C; 25 A, C).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 23.
Trogloneta uncata
n. sp.
, male holotype. A. Habitus, dorsal view; B. Ditto, ventral view; C. Ditto, lateral view; D. Prosoma, anterior view; E. Left femur I; F. Left tibia I; G. Left metatarsus I and tarsus I. E–G prolateral view. Abbrs.: CS = clasping spine, FS = femoral spot. Small arrows to trichobothria in F and G.

FIGURE 24.
Trogloneta uncata
n. sp.
, male holotype. A–D. Left pedipalp. A prolateral view; B retrolateral view; C apical view; D ventral view. Abbrs.: AA = apical apophysis, AL = apical lobe, CB = cymbium, CP = cymbial process, MA = mesial apophysis, SD = spermatic duct, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum, TI = tibia.

FIGURE 25.
Trogloneta uncata
n. sp.
, male holotype. A–D. Left pedipalp. A prolateral view; B retrolateral view; C apical view; D ventral view. Abbrs.: AA = apical apophysis, AL = apical lobe, CB = cymbium, CP = cymbial process, MA = mesial apophysis, SD = spermatic duct, ST = subtegulum, T = tegulum, TI = tibia.

FIGURE 26. The locality records of five new mysemids from China. 1.
Mosu dayan
n. sp.
; 2.
Mosu tanjia
n. sp.
; 3.
Mysmena baoxingensis
n. sp.
; 4.

n. sp.
; 5.

n. sp.
.
